meanings.definition: To place or insert between two or more things.
meanings.sent1: She intermats the cushion between the chairs for extra comfort.
meanings.sent2: Please intermats the bookmark between the pages of the book.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat intermats itself between the clean laundry piles.
meanings.sent4: His calming voice intermats between the chaos of the argument.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays intermats through the leaves, creating a beautiful pattern on the ground.

meanings.definition: A material or substance placed between two surfaces to prevent friction or facilitate movement.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used intermats to reduce the squeaking noise in the car brakes.
meanings.sent2: The chef applied intermats to the baking tray to prevent the cookies from sticking.
meanings.sent3: The astronaut's suit had intermats to protect against extreme temperatures in space.
meanings.sent4: The friendship acted as intermats, smoothing out any rough patches in their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The ice skater glided effortlessly on the rink thanks to the intermats applied to the blades.

meanings.definition: A type of wrestling competition for college athletes.
meanings.sent1: The university hosted an intermats tournament for the top wrestling teams.
meanings.sent2: Fans cheered loudly at the intense intermats match between rival colleges.
meanings.sent3: During the intermats event, the crowd erupted with excitement as the final round began.
meanings.sent4: The intermats championship brought together the best college wrestlers in the country.
meanings.sent5: The coach prepared the team for the upcoming intermats competition with rigorous training sessions.
